etymology.description: 库(storage; repository) + 门(door; gate) = doorway/portal; in Wu dialect, doorframe.
etymology.interpretation: Originally ‘gate of a storehouse,’ the compound generalized to mean an entrance or doorway. In Wu topolect, 库 broadened toward ‘house/room,’ so 库门 specifically refers to the doorframe (门框).
etymology.simplification: 庫門 → 库门 via standard character simplification: 車 → 车 within 庫, and 門 → 门, reducing strokes for common components.

examples.chinese: 我把鞋子摆在库门边(我把鞋子擺在庫門邊)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bǎ xiézi bǎi zài kùmén biān.
examples.english: I placed my shoes by the doorway.

examples.chinese: 他站在库门等我们(他站在庫門等我們)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhàn zài kùmén děng wǒmen.
examples.english: He is waiting for us at the gateway.

examples.chinese: 在吴语里(在吳語裡)，库门指门框(庫門指門框)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Wúyǔ lǐ, kùmén zhǐ ménkuàng.
examples.english: In the Wu dialect, kùmén means the doorframe.
